original: Catuṣpariṣatsūtra
analyzed: catuṣpariṣad sūtra
translated: Sutra of the Fourfold Assembly

original: Section E
analyzed: section e
translated: Section E

original: bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara nadyā nairajanāyās tīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara nadyāḥ nairajanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam
translated: The Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, was dwelling at Uruvilvā, on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly practicing, being careful, and engaged in the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening.

original: anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: He was dwelling in that way.

original: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme ṛddhiviṣayajñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyā citta abhinirnāmayaty anekavidham ṛddhiviṣaya pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme ṛddhi viṣaya jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyā citta abhinirnāmayati anekavidham ṛddhi viṣaya pratyanubhavati
translated: In the first watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the range of psychic powers, and experienced various kinds of psychic powers.

original: tadyathā eko bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati / bahudhā bhūtvā eko bhavati / āvir bhavati tirobhāva
analyzed: tat yathā ekaḥ bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati bahudhā bhūtvā ekaḥ bhavati āvis bhavati tirobhāva
translated: That is to say, having been one, he became many; having been many, he became one. He became visible, invisible.

original: jñānadarśanena pratyanubhavati / tiraskuḍya tiraḥśaila tiraḥprākāram asajyamānaḥ🔽kāyena gacchati tadyathā ākāśe / pṛthivyām unmajjananimajjana karoti tadyathā udake /
analyzed: jñāna darśanena pratyanubhavati tiraskuḍya tiras śaila tiras prākāram a sajyamānaḥ  kāyena gacchati tat yathā ākāśe pṛthivyām unmajjana nimajjana karoti tat yathā udake
translated: He experienced it with the knowledge and vision of his own mind. He passed through walls, through ramparts, through mountains without sticking.🔽He went through solid ground as if through space, and he emerged from the earth as if from water.

original: udake asajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tadyathā pṛthivyām / ākāśe paryagena vikramate
analyzed: udake a sajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tat yathā pṛthivyām ākāśe paryagena vikramate
translated: He walked on water without sinking as if on solid ground. He traveled cross-legged through the sky like a bird.

original: tadyathā pakṣī śakuniḥ / imāv api candrasūryau evamahardhikau evamahānubhāvau pāṇinā
analyzed: tat yathā pakṣī śakuniḥ imau api candra sūryau eva mahardhikau eva mahā anubhāvau pāṇinā
translated: Just as a bird, a bird of prey. And he touches and strokes with his hand

original: āmārjati parimārjayati yāvad brahmalokād api kāyena vaśe vartayati /
analyzed: āmārjati parimārjayati yāvat brahma lokāt api kāyena vaśe vartayati
translated: the moon and sun, which are so powerful and majestic, and he exercises power with his body as far as the Brahma world.

original: iti bodhisatvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara nadyā nairajanāyās tīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī
analyzed: iti bodhisatvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara nadyāḥ nairajanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī
translated: Thus the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelt in Urubilvā on the banks of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly practicing,

original: nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto vihara rātryāḥ prathame yāme
analyzed: nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ vihara rātryāḥ prathame yāme
translated: attentive, dwelling in application to the cultivation of the factors of awakening, in the first watch of the night,

original: anekavidham ṛddhiviṣaya pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: anekavidham ṛddhi viṣaya pratyanubhavati
translated: he experienced various kinds of supernormal powers.

original: atha bodhisatvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisatvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelt in Urubilvā as before, up to dwelling in application.

original: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsānusrtijñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyā cittam abhinirnāmayati so nekavidha pūrvenivāsa samanusmarati
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsa anusrti jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyā cittam abhinirnāmayati saḥ nekavidha pūrvenivāsa samanusmarati
translated: In the first watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the recollection of past lives, and he remembered various past lives,

original: tadyathaikā jāti dve tisraś catasraḥ yāvad anekān api savartakalpān samanusmarati /
analyzed: tat yathā ekā jāti dve tisraḥ catasraḥ yāvat anekān api savarta kalpān samanusmarati
translated: such as one birth, two, three, four, up to many eons of evolution.

original: iti bodhisatvo bhagavā urubilvāyā vihara nadyā nairajanāyās tīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī
analyzed: iti bodhisatvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara nadyāḥ nairajanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī
translated: Thus the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelt in Uruvilvā, on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, practicing continuously,

original: nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto vihara rātryāḥ prathame yāme
analyzed: nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ vihara rātryāḥ prathame yāme
translated: attentive, and devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening. In the first watch of the night,

original: pūrvenivāsa samanusmarati /
analyzed: pūrvenivāsa samanusmarati
translated: he remembered his previous abodes.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelt in Uruvilvā, as before, up to devoted to the practice of meditation.

original: sa rātryā madhyame yāme divyaśrotrajñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyā cittam abhinirnāmayati
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya śrotra jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyā cittam abhinirnāmayati
translated: In the middle watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the divine ear.

original: divyena śrotreṇa viśuddhenātikrātamānuṣeṇa ubhayām śabdā śṛṇoti mānuṣāś cāmānuṣāś🔽ca ye vā dūre ye vāntike /
analyzed: divyena śrotreṇa viśuddhena atikrāta mānuṣeṇa ubhayām śabdā śṛṇoti mānuṣāḥ ca amānuṣāḥ  ca ye vā dūre ye vā antike
translated: With his divine ear, which is purified and surpasses the human, he hears both kinds of sounds, divine and human, whether far or near.

original: iti bodhisatvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara nadyā nairajanāyās tīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī
analyzed: iti bodhisatvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara nadyāḥ nairajanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī
translated: Thus the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelt in Uruvilvā, on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, practicing continuously,

original: nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto vihara rātryā madhyame yāme
analyzed: nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ vihara rātryāḥ madhyame yāme
translated: attentive, and devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening. In the middle watch of the night,

original: divyaśrotrajñāna pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: pratyanubhavati
translated: he experienced the supernormal knowledge of the divine ear.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelt in Urubilvā as before, up to he dwells heedful, ardent, and resolute.

original: sa rātryā madhyame yāme divyacakṣurjñānasākṣīkriyāyā vidyāyā cittam abhinirnāmayati /🔽divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhenātikrāntamānuṣeṇa sattvān paśyati cyavamānān apy upapadyamānān🔽api suvarṇān api durvarṇān api hīnān api praṇītān api sugatim api gacchato durgatim
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya cakṣuḥ jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ vidyāyāḥ cittam abhinirnāmayati  divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣeṇa sattvān paśyati cyavamānān api upapadyamānān  api suvarṇān api durvarṇān api hīnān api praṇītān api sugatim api gacchataḥ durgatim
translated: In the middle watch of the night, he directs his mind to the knowledge and insight of the divine eye.🔽With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he understands how beings fare in accordance with their kamma:

original: api yathākarmopagān sattvān yathābhūta prajānāti /
analyzed: api yathā karma upagān sattvān yathābhūta prajānāti
translated: These beings, dear friends, who were ill-conducted in body, speech, and mind, who reviled the noble ones, had wrong view, and undertook actions based on wrong view,

original: itīme bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāyaduścaritena samanvāgatā vāṅmanoduścaritena samanvāgatā
analyzed: iti ime bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāya duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ vāc manaḥ duścaritena samanvāgatā
translated: with the breakup of the body, after death, have been reborn in a bad realm of existence, a lower realm, a hell.

original: āryāṇām apavādakā mithyādṛṣṭayo mithyāḍṛṣṭikarmadharmasamādānahetos taddhetos tatpratyaya
analyzed: āryāṇām apavādakāḥ mithyādṛṣṭayaḥ mithyāḍṛṣṭi karma dharma samādāna hetoḥ tad hetoḥ tad pratyaya
translated: But these beings, dear friends, who were well-conducted in body, speech, and mind, who did not revile the noble ones, who had right view, and undertook actions based on right view,

original: kāyasya bhedāt para maraṇād apāyadurgativinipātam narakeṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: kāyasya bhedāt maraṇāt apāya durgati vinipātam narakeṣu upapadyante
translated: with the breakup of the body, after death, have been reborn in a good realm of existence, a heavenly world.🔽Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he understands how beings fare in accordance with their kamma.

original: ime vā punar bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāyasucaritena samanvāgatā vāṅmanaḥsucaritena samanvāgatā
analyzed: ime vā punar bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāya su caritena samanvāgatāḥ vāc manaḥ su caritena samanvāgatā
translated: Or, these beings, endowed with good bodily conduct, endowed with good verbal and mental conduct,

original: āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyagḍṛṣṭayaḥ samyagdṛṣṭikarmadharmasamādānahetos taddhetos
analyzed: āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyagḍṛṣṭayaḥ samyagdṛṣṭi karma dharma samādāna hetoḥ tad hetoḥ
translated: not disparaging the noble ones, having right view, due to undertaking actions and observances with right view,

original: tatpratyaya kāyasya bhedāt sugatau svargaloke deveṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: bhedāt sugatau svarga loke deveṣu upapadyante
translated: due to that cause, due to that condition, at the breaking up of the body, after death, are reborn in a good realm, in heaven, among the gods.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara nadyā nairajanāyās tīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara nadyāḥ nairajanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī
translated: Thus the Bodhisattva, the Blessed One, dwelt at Uruvilvā on the bank of the river Nairañjanā, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, practicing continuously,

original: nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto vihara rātryā madhyame yāme
analyzed: nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ vihara rātryāḥ madhyame yāme
translated: attentive, devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening, dwelling in the middle part of the night

original: divyacakṣurjñāna pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: pratyanubhavati
translated: experiencing the knowledge of the divine eye.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /🔽sa rātryāḥ paścime yāme cetaḥparyāyajñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati  sa rātryāḥ paścime yāme cetaḥ paryāya jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, the Blessed One, dwelt at Uruvilvā as before, up to devoted to the practice of meditation.🔽In the last part of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the knowledge of the mental activity of others.

original: parasattvānā parapudgalānā vitarkita vicarita manasā mānasa yathābhūta prajānāti /
analyzed: para sattvānā para pudgalānā vitarkita vicarita manasā mānasa yathābhūta prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the thoughts and mental activity of other beings and other persons, having investigated with his own mind.

original: sarāgacitta sarāga cittam iti yathābhūta prajānāti / vigatarāga vigatarāgam iti
analyzed: sa rāga citta sa rāga cittam iti yathābhūta prajānāti vigata rāga vigata rāgam iti
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with passion as a mind with passion, and a mind without passion as a mind without passion.

original: yathābhūta prajānāti / sadveṣa vigatadveṣa samoha vigatamoha vikṣipta sakṣipta🔽līna pragṛhītam uddhatam anuddhata avyupaśānta vyupaśānta samāhitam asamāhitam
analyzed: yathābhūta prajānāti sa dveṣa vigata dveṣa sa moha vigata moha vikṣipta sa kṣipta  līna pragṛhītam uddhatam anuddhata avyupaśānta vyupaśānta samāhitam asamāhitam
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with hatred as a mind with hatred, and a mind without hatred as a mind without hatred. He knows as it really is a mind with delusion as a mind with delusion, and a mind without delusion as a mind without delusion. He knows as it really is a distracted mind as a distracted mind, and a concentrated mind as a concentrated mind.🔽He knows as it really is a depressed mind as a depressed mind, and an uplifted mind as an uplifted mind. He knows as it really is an unliberated mind as an unliberated mind, and a liberated mind as a liberated mind.

original: abhāvita bhāvita avimukta cittam avimukta cittam iti yathābhūta prajānāti /
analyzed: abhāvita bhāvita avimukta cittam avimukta cittam iti yathābhūta prajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is an undeveloped mind as an undeveloped mind, and a developed mind as a developed mind.

original: vimuktaṇn citta vimukta cittam iti yathābhūta prajānāti /
analyzed: vimuktaṇn citta vimukta cittam iti yathābhūta prajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is an unliberated mind as an unliberated mind, and a liberated mind as a liberated mind.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara nadyā nairajanāyās tīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara nadyāḥ nairajanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī
translated: Thus, the Blessed Bodhisattva dwelt in Urubilvā on the banks of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly practicing,

original: nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto vihara rātryāḥ paścime yāme
analyzed: nipakaḥ bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ vihara rātryāḥ paścime yāme
translated: attentive, and devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening, during the last watch of the night

original: cetaḥparyāyajñāna pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: pratyanubhavati
translated: he experienced the knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then, the Blessed Bodhisattva dwelt in Urubilvā as before, up to devoted to the practice of meditation.

original: sa rātryāḥ paścime yāme āsravakṣayajñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyā cittam abhinirnāmayati /🔽ida duḥkham āryasatyam iti yathābhūta prajānāti / aya duḥkhasamudayaḥ / aya duḥkhanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ paścime yāme āsrava kṣaya jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyā cittam abhinirnāmayati  ida duḥkham ārya satyam iti yathābhūta prajānāti aya duḥkha samudayaḥ aya duḥkha nirodhaḥ
translated: In the last watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the direct knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants.🔽He knew as it really is: “This is suffering,” “This is the origin of suffering,” “This is the cessation of suffering,”

original: iya duḥkhanirodhagāminī pratipad āryasatyam iti yathābhūta prajānāti / tasyaiva
analyzed: iya duḥkha nirodha gāminī pratipad ārya satyam iti yathābhūta prajānāti tasya eva
translated: “This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.”

original: jānata eva paśyataḥ kāmāsravāc citta vimucyate / bhavāsravād avidyāsravāc citta🔽vimucyate / vimuktasya vimukto smīti jñānadarśana bhavati / kṣīṇā me jātir uṣita
analyzed: jānataḥ eva paśyataḥ kāma āsravāt citta vimucyate bhava āsravāt avidyā āsravāt citta  vimucyate vimuktasya smi iti jñāna darśana bhavati kṣīṇā me jātiḥ uṣita
translated: For him, knowing and seeing thus, his mind was liberated from the pollutant of sensual desire, from the pollutant of existence, and from the pollutant of ignorance.

original: brahmacarya kṛta karaṇīya nāparam asmād bhava prajānāmīti /
analyzed: brahmacarya kṛta karaṇīya na aparam asmāt bhava prajānāmi iti
translated: When it was liberated, there came the knowledge: “It is liberated.” He knew: “Birth is exhausted, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.”

original: iti bhagavān urubilvāyā vihara nadyā nairajanāyās tīre bodhimūle kṛtakṛtyaḥ kṛtakaraṇīyaḥ sabuddhabodhis tejodhātu samāpannaḥ
analyzed: iti bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ vihara nadyāḥ nairajanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle kṛtakṛtyaḥ kṛta karaṇīyaḥ sa buddha bodhiḥ tejaḥ dhātu samāpannaḥ
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, having dwelt at Uruvilvā on the bank of the river Nairañjanā at the foot of the Goatherd's Banyan tree, having accomplished the Buddha's work, entered the fire element and attained the state of composure without remainder.

original: Section
analyzed: section
translated: Section

original: atha dvayor brahmakāyikayor devatayor etad abhavat /
analyzed: atha dvayoḥ brahmakāyikayoḥ devatayoḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to two deities of the Brahma world:

original: aya buddho bhagavān urubilvāyā viharati nadyā nairajanāyās tīre bodhimūle acirābhisabuddhabodhis
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyāḥ viharati nadyāḥ nairajanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle acira abhisabuddha bodhi
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was dwelling at Uruvilvā, on the bank of the river Nairañjanā, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, not long after his enlightenment.

original: tejodhātusamāpannaḥ saptāham ekaparyakenātināmayati / na caina kaścit piṇḍakena
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātu samāpannaḥ sapta aham eka paryakena atināmayati na ca ena kaścid piṇḍakena
translated: He was absorbed in the fire element for seven days and nights in a single cross-legged position, and no one offered him almsfood.

original: pratipādayati / yannu mayam ena gatvā pratyekapratyeka gāthābhir abhiṣtuyāma iti /
analyzed: pratipādayati yat nu mayam ena gatvā pratyeka pratyeka gāthābhiḥ abhiṣtuyāmaḥ iti
translated: Let us go and praise him with individual verses.

original: atha dve brahmakāyike devate tadyathā balavān puruṣaḥ sammijita vā bāhu prasārayet
analyzed: atha dve brahmakāyike devate tat yathā balavān puruṣaḥ vā bāhu prasārayet
translated: Then two gods from the Brahma realm, just as a strong man might stretch out a bent arm

original: prasārita vā samiñjayed evam eva dve brahmakāyike devate brahmaloke ntarhite bhagavataḥ
analyzed: vā samiñjayet evam eva dve brahmakāyike devate brahma loke ntarhite bhagavataḥ
translated: or bend in an outstretched arm, so did those two gods disappear from the Brahma realm and appear

original: purataḥ pratyasthātām //
analyzed: puratas pratyasthātām

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar asya etat abhava mā ha eva kumāraḥ coraiḥ vā dhūrtaiḥ vā svāpateya kāraṇāt
translated: abandoned. Having seen them, he thought: Don't let it be that the prince has been taken outside by thieves or swindlers for the sake of his wealth.

original: bahir niṣkrāmito bhaviṣyati mā haiva kumāro tena tīrthena nadī bārakām uttīrṇo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bahis niṣkrāmitaḥ bhaviṣyati mā ha eva tena tīrthena nadī bārakām uttīrṇaḥ bhaviṣyati

analyzed: adrākṣīt bhagavān agrakulika gṛhapati dūratas eva dṛṣṭvā ca punar asya etat abhavat
translated: The Blessed One saw the householder Agrapālaka from afar. Having seen him, this occurred to him:

analyzed: yanu aha tadrūpan ṛdhi abhisaskārān abhisaskuryāḥ yathā agrakulikaḥ gṛhapatiḥ asmin
translated: Let me perform such a feat of supernormal power that the householder Agrapālaka,

original: evāsane niṣaṇṇa yaśam agrakulikaputra na paśyed /
analyzed: eva āsane niṣaṇṇa yaśam agrakulika putra na paśyet
translated: while seated on this very seat, will not see Yaśa, the son of Agrapālaka.

translated: Then the Blessed One performed such a feat of supernormal power that the householder Agrapālaka, while seated on that very seat, did not see the young man Yaśa.

analyzed: atha agrakulikaḥ gṛhapatiḥ yena bhagavān tena upajagāma upetya bhagavatam idam avocat
translated: Then the householder Agrapālaka approached the Blessed One and said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: kaccit bhagavān yaśa kumāram adrākṣīt
translated: Has the Blessed One seen the young man Yaśa?

original: tena hi gṛhapate niṣīdasva sthānam etad vidyate yad ihaivāgatam asminn āsane niṣaṇṇa yaśa kumāra drakṣyasīti /

translated: Well then, householder, sit down. It is possible that while seated here on this very seat, you will see the young man Yaśa.

original: athāgrakulikasya gṛhapater etad abhavat / nūna bhagavatā yaśaḥ kumāro dṛṣṭo bhaviṣyati
analyzed: atha agrakulikasya gṛhapateḥ etat abhavat nūna bhagavatā yaśaḥ kumāraḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Then this occurred to the householder Agrapālaka: Surely the Blessed One has seen the young man Yaśa.

analyzed: tathā hi bhagavān evam āha tena hi gṛhapate niṣīda sthānam etat vidyate yat asmin
translated: For the Blessed One said this: Then, householder, sit down. There is a place here

translated: where, sitting on this very seat, you will see the young man Yaśa. Knowing this, he was delighted, satisfied, joyful, uplifted,🔽and filled with happiness and gladness. Having bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, he sat to one side.

original: samuttejayati saprahaṛsayatiyā sā buddhānā bhagavatā pūrve kālakaranīyā dhārmī🔽kathā tadyathā dānakathā śīlakathā svargakathā kāmānām āsvādādīnava sakleśavyavadāna
analyzed: samuttejayati sā buddhānā bhagavatā pūrve kāla karanīyā dhārmī  kathā tat yathā dāna kathā śīla kathā svarga kathā kāmānām āsvāda ādīnava sa kleśa vyavadāna
translated: While the householder, the head of a great clan, was sitting to one side, the Blessed One instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted him with a discourse on dhamma.🔽That discourse on dhamma which the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, first give, which is about giving, virtue, and heaven,

original: naiṣkramyapraviveke ānuśasa vyavadānapakṣyān dharmān vistareṇa saprakāśayati yadā
analyzed: naiṣkramya praviveke vyavadāna pakṣyān dharmān vistareṇa saprakāśayati yadā
translated: about the danger, degradation, and defilement of sensual desires, and about the benefits of renunciation,

analyzed: bhagavān adrākṣīt dhṛṣṭa cittam kalya citta mudita citta vinivaraṇa citta bhavya
translated: when the Blessed One saw that his mind was uplifted, delighted, confident, and free from hindrances,🔽he then revealed the noble truth of suffering to him,

translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, then gave him the Dharma teaching that is appropriate for those with the highest abilities.🔽The Dharma teaching that is appropriate for those with the highest abilities is as follows: the four noble truths, in detail,

translated: Just as a pure cloth, free from stains, would properly receive dye,

analyzed: samyak eva pratigṛhṇāti evam eva agrakulikaḥ gṛhapatiḥ tasmin eva āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ

translated: having crossed over doubt, having no more perplexity, not dependent on others, not led by others in the Teacher's teachings, having attained confidence in the Dharma,

analyzed: abhikrāntaḥ ha bhadantaḥ abhikrāntaḥ eṣaḥ ha bhagavata śaraṇa gacchāmi dharma
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, householder! It is good that you have such faith and confidence in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

translated: I will remember you as a lay follower who has gone for refuge from today for as long as life lasts.🔽 When this Dharma teaching was being given, the Dharma eye arose in the householder Agrapukkusaka, free from dust and stainless,

original: cittam vimukta /
analyzed: cittam vimukta
translated: and the mind of the young man Yasa was liberated from the defilements without grasping.

translated: placing the rod down towards all beings,

analyzed: sa brāhmaṇaḥ sa śramaṇaḥ sa bhikṣuḥ
translated: he is a brahmin, an ascetic, a monk.

original: athāgrakuliko gṛhapatir yaśa kumāram idam avocat /
analyzed: atha agrakulikaḥ gṛhapatiḥ yaśa kumāram idam avocat
translated: Then the householder Agrapukkusaka said this to the young man Yasa:

analyzed: ehi kumāra niveśana gamiṣyāmaḥ mātā te śrānta kāyā klānta kāyā paridevati
translated: Come, young man, let us go to the house. Your mother is lamenting, her body exhausted, her body weary.

original: atha bhagavān agrakulika gṛhapatim idam avocat /
analyzed: atha bhagavān agrakulika gṛhapatim idam avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to the householder Agrayhika:

analyzed: ki manyase gṛhapate yena idānīm aśaikṣeṇa jñānena aśaikṣeṇa darśanena catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: What do you think, householder? Now that you have realized the four noble truths

analyzed: yathā khalu tvayā gṛhapate śaikṣeṇa jñānena śaikṣeṇa darśanena catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: Just as you, householder, have realized the four noble truths

analyzed: abhisamitāni duḥkha samudayaḥ nirodhaḥ mārga evam eva yaśena kumāreṇa aśaikṣeṇa jñānena
translated: with the knowledge and insight of one in training - suffering, its arising, its cessation, and the path - in the same way, the young man Yaśa, with the knowledge and insight of one beyond training,

translated: The teaching of the Dharma is as follows: he expounds in detail the four noble truths, which are suffering, origination, cessation, and the path.
